headLine: MA Governance of Technology and Innovation (GovTec)

blueBox.headLine: Master Program
blueBox.content: The Master Program Governance of Technology and Innovation (GovTec) will be launched in the winter term 2019/2020. It is an interdisciplinary Master’s program in Philosophy and Sociology of Science and Technology with links to Science and Technology Studies (STS). The Master’s program addresses theoretical as well as practical aspects of developing and implementing technology and innovation. It investigates the role of technology and innovation as drivers for today’s society.

box1.headLine: 1st Semester: Basic courses
box1.content:
Module 1: Wissenstheorie des Forschens (Knowledge Theory of Research)
Module 2: Innovieren im Wandel (Changes in Innovation)
Module 3: Governance von Wissenschaft und Innovation (Governance of Science and Innovation

box2.headLine: 2nd Semester: Advanced courses
box2.content:
Module 4: Modelling for Innovation
Module 5: Technology Assessment
Module 6: Responsible Research and Innovation

box3.headLine: 1st to 3rd Semester: Elective course
box3.content:
Module 7: Governance of socio-technical change
  • A: Managing the innovation Process
  • B: Sustainability Strategies in Politics and Companies
  • C: Techniksoziologie
  • D: Technologie und Politik
  • E: Entscheidungslehre

box4.headLine: 3rd Semester: Practice
box4.content:
Module 8: Practice
  • 1-week workshop on STS-methods
  • 10-weeks internship/10-weeks graduate project, respectively
  • 1-week colloquium on governance of socio-technical change (module 7)

box5.headLine: 4th Semester: Master
box5.content:
Module 9: Master
  • Master colloquium
  • Master thesis (50-60 pages)
  • Master presentation and discussion (30 minutes)
